verb.description: Place or fix (equipment or machinery) in position ready for use.
examples: we're planning to install a new shower

verb.description: Place (someone) in a new position of authority, especially with ceremony.
examples: he was installed as music director at the Cathedral of St. Barbara in Cracow

origin: Late Middle English (in install (sense 2)): from medieval Latin installare, from in- into + stallum place, stall. install (sense 1) dates from the mid 19th century.
